page.title: 10The Parish Council
page.content: There are 10{Meetings}a year, one a month, the exceptions being August and September. Meetings are held in the Parish Hall from 7.10pm. The{Members}of the Council are Mr Babey, Mr Baker, Hrs Hollands, Mr Mills, Mrs Penny, Mrs Reeves, Mr Thomas and Dr. Wainwright. There was no{Election}needed as only 7 people put up for 9 places. The Council advertised for 2 more members. The Council has succeeded in getting a lollipop lady; lights under the Motorwaybridge and prescriptions to be made up at the Post Office in the mornings. They are still fighting for speed limits on the roads and to stop too many planned extensions to forest cottages.Rural bus services were also something which was needed but little used.
